cash_05 wrote:
> Hi all,
> 
> I'm new to web crawler. I download and install Heritrix into my Linux
> box. Start the crawler like what the user manual said. Then login to
> the WUI and created a crawl job using default setting. I put in
> http://www.testserver.com/ in the seed list.
> The job start and finised fine. But with very little result return.
> 
> In my arch/xxxxxx.arc file, after the information section, only 3
> lines for every seed i used. for example,
> 
> dns:www.testserver.com 111.111.111.111 200501010101 text/dns 58
> 200501010202
> www.testserver.com. 86400 IN A 111.111.111.111

DNS lookups for your seeds are succeeding.

> And the content of my seeds-report.txt is always like
> [seeds]                   [res-code]  [status]
> http://www.testserver.com -61         NOTCRAWLED
> 
> Why is this -61 code returned and why NotCrawled?

You can look up crawl.log status codes in the manual here:

  http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html#statuscodes

"-61" is "Prerequisite robots.txt-fetch failed, precluding a fetch attempt"

The server(s) may be completely unreachable -- so Heritrix isn't
even getting a 404 for /robots.txt. From the same machine on which
Heritrix is running, can you access the sites with a web browser?
(Do you need to use a web proxy to do so?)

Alternative, something about the crawl configuration may be preventing
/robots.txt from being fetched. If you have changed the scope, added
filters, or reduced the allowable 'max-trans-hops' for your crawl,
this might be the case.

Does the crawl show as 'finished' very quickly? If so, your crawl
configuration is probably to blame -- the /robots.txt URLs were never
tried.

If the crawl shows as running for a while, but makes no progress, it's
retrying the /robots.txt multiple times with pauses between, but failing --
in which case it's probably your network. (After it is done with retries,
the /robots.txt URLs will show in the crawl.log with whatever error
caused their last failure.)

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA
